attributes.comment:
I am writing concerning the proposed increase in fees for the filing of the (I171H)
(1600). I am an adoptive parent, or actually a waiting adoptive parent. There are
many many fees involved in an international adoption. The costs associated with
an adoption are what many would consider exorberant. But as adoptive parents
we pay them. It seems unreasonable first, when most adoptions exceed the
allowable time on the I171Hwhich is currently 18 months, and 12 months for our
fingerprints. So not only are we required to pay these fees once, but 95 percent of
the time families are taxed with paying these fees twice. And now you want to
force us to pay an increase in these fees, twice!!! Let's be fair about this. For
many of us adoption is the only choice we have to have a family. We prove over
and over again that we are suitable parents, by many governmental institutions. It
seems that we are being treated unfairly. I am one of those families that have
been waiting in excess of a year. Our fingerprints expire in two months and our
immigration expires in 8 months. Which unfortuanately will force us to pay fees
we have already paid once to get a form we already have...AND now we are going
to have to pay an even higher fee for forms we already have. IT's unjust and unfair,
and just plain not neccessary.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Ann Crews
